snippet: Thousands of Vietnam-era veterans denied benefits because of less-than-honorable discharges may be eligible for upgrades if their misconduct was related to post-traumatic stress disorder.
abstract: Defense Dept releases new rules that could grant upgrades to thousands of Vietnam-era veterans who have been barred from receiving benefits due to less-than-honorable discharges; rules offer first guidance to military discharge review boards on how to address post-traumatic stress disorder.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of Vietnam-era veterans denied benefits because of less-than-honorable discharges may be eligible for upgrades if their misconduct was related to post-traumatic stress disorder.

headline.main: New Rules May Allow Benefits Long Denied to Vietnam-Era Veterans
headline.print_headline: New Rules May Aid Veterans of Vietnam
